summary: On February 3, 1959, a plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa, killed famous musicians Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, J.P. Richardson (The Big Bopper), and pilot Roger Peterson. This day became known as "The Day the Music Died" because of a song by Don McLean. The musicians were on a tour and decided to charter a plane to avoid the cold, uncomfortable buses. Unfortunately, the plane crashed in bad weather, taking all four lives. People remember this event with monuments and annual concerts in Clear Lake.
title: The Day the Music Died
